meanings.definition: Sassy - impudent or disrespectful in speech or behavior
meanings.sent1: The girl gave a sassies response to her teacher, which got her in trouble.
meanings.sent2: She always wears the sassies outfits to school, standing out from the rest.
meanings.sent3: When the cat knocked over the vase, it gave a sassies look as if it was proud of the mess.
meanings.sent4: The rebellious teenager's sassies attitude towards authority figures often caused conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The sassies child refused to listen to any rules, always speaking out of turn.

meanings.definition: Sassy - stylish or fashionable in an unconventional way
meanings.sent1: Her unique and sassies sense of fashion always turned heads wherever she went.
meanings.sent2: The boutique showcased the sassies clothing items that were unlike anything seen before.
meanings.sent3: The artist's painting was so sassies that it sparked a new trend in the art world.
meanings.sent4: The singer's music video featured a sassies dance routine that became viral overnight.
meanings.sent5: The fashion show displayed the sassies designs that pushed the boundaries of traditional style.

meanings.definition: Sassy - to talk back or be cheeky in response to someone
meanings.sent1: The child sassies at his parents whenever they ask him to do chores.
meanings.sent2: She sassies at her boss whenever he gives her feedback on her work.
meanings.sent3: During the argument, he couldn't help but sassies at his friend's ridiculous statement.
meanings.sent4: The comedian loves to sassies at the audience, making everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent5: When feeling challenged, she tends to sassies at anyone who questions her decisions.
